s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT CABLE FROM NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL

atten2.ptxt: Wait at least 90 seconds after disconnecting the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal to prevent airbag activation.

s-1.ptxt: PLACE FRONT WHEEL FACING STRAIGHT AHEAD

s2.ptxt: Using a T30 "TORX" socket wrench, loosen the 2 screws until the groove along the screw circumference catches on the screw case.
Pull out the steering pad from the steering wheel as shown in the illustration. Then support the steering pad with one hand.

atten3.ptxt: When removing the steering pad, do not pull the airbag wire harness.

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the horn connector.
Disconnect the connector and remove the steering pad .

atten3.ptxt: When handling the airbag connector, take care not to damage the airbag wire harness.

s2.ptxt: Remove the steering wheel set nut.
Place matchmarks on the steering wheel and main shaft.
Using SST, remove the steering wheel.
Remove the 3 screws and lower cover.
Disconnect the connectors.
Detach the claw and remove the windshield wiper switch assembly.

atten3.ptxt: Do not push the claw with excessive force as damage may occur.

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the connector.
Using needle-nose pliers, remove the band clamp as shown in the illustration.
Using a screwdriver, detach the claw and remove the switch.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the connectors from the spiral cable.

atten3.ptxt: When handling the airbag connector, do not damage the airbag wire harness.

s2.ptxt: Detach the 3 claws and remove the spiral cable.
Remove the 4 bolts and under cover.
Remove the 4 bolts and under cover.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT SIDE MEMBER TO FRONT SUSPENSION CROSSMEMBER BRACE

s2.ptxt: Remove the 8 bolts and crossmember brace.
Remove the front stabilizer bar from the vehicle body.

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT TIE ROD END SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the cotter pin and nut.
Using SST, disconnect the tie rod end from the steering knuckle arm.

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT TIE ROD END SUB-ASSEMBLY RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedures described for the LH side.

s2.ptxt: Loosen the bolt labeled A.
Make matchmarks on the steering yoke and steering intermediate shaft.
Remove the bolt labeled B.
Disconnect the steering sliding yoke from the No. 2 steering intermediate shaft.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE NO. 2 STEERING INTERMEDIATE SHAFT SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Make matchmarks on the intermediate shaft and steering link.
Remove the bolt and intermediate shaft from the steering link.

atten3.ptxt: If the intermediate shaft is struck, replace it with a new one.

s2.ptxt: Using a union nut wrench, loosen the flare nut and disconnect the pressure feed tube.
Remove the bolt and disconnect the pressure feed tube from the steering link.

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT STEERING GEAR OUTLET RETURN TUBE

s2.ptxt: Disengage the clip and disconnect the return hose.
Using a union nut wrench, disconnect the outlet return tube.
Fix the 2 nuts in place and remove the 2 bolts. Then remove the link from the frame.

atten3.ptxt: Never turn the nut. Be sure to turn the bolt.

atten4.ptxt: Removal of the link may be easier if the following is performed: 1) remove the differential mount, and 2) slide the differential toward the rear of the vehicle.
